Title.evidence: This cluster randomized clinical trial of 577 eligible patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were cluster randomized by room

Participants.evidence: 577 eligible patients enrolled 377 older patients (≥65 years of age) undergoing gastrectomy, pancreaticoduodenectomy, and colectomy at a 2000-bed urban medical center in Taipei, Taiwan

Intervention.evidence: The intervention (implemented by an mHELP nurse) consisted of 3 protocols administered daily: orienting communication, oral and nutritional assistance, and early mobilization.

Objective.evidence: Objective: To examine whether a modified Hospital Elder Life Program (mHELP) reduces incident delirium and LOS in older patients undergoing abdominal surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Presence of delirium was assessed daily by 2 trained nurses who were masked to intervention status by using the Confusion Assessment Method.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were cluster randomized by room

Blinding.evidence: Presence of delirium was assessed daily by 2 trained nurses who were masked to intervention status

Number_Randomised.evidence: 377 (65.3%) were enrolled and randomly assigned to the mHELP (n = 197) or control (n = 180) group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Postoperative delirium occurred in 13 of 196 (6.6%) mHELP participants vs 27 of 179 (15.1%) control individuals

Result_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative delirium occurred in 13 of 196 (6.6%) mHELP participants vs 27 of 179 (15.1%) control individuals, representing a relative risk of 0.44 in the mHELP group (95% CI, 0.23–0.83; P = .008).
